verses.verse: Why<WH4100> do the heathen<WH1471> rage,<WH7283> and the people<WH3816> imagine<WH1897> a vain<WH7385> thing?

The kings<WH4428> of the earth<WH776> set<WH3320> themselves, and the rulers<WH7336> take counsel<WH3245> together,<WH3162> against<WH5921> the LORD,<WH3068> and against<WH5921> his anointed,<WH4899> saying,
Let us break<WH5423> their bands<WH4147> asunder, and cast<WH7993> away their cords<WH5688> from us.
He that sits<WH3427> in the heavens<WH8064> shall laugh:<WH7832> the LORD<WH136> shall have them in derision.<WH3932>
Then<WH227> shall he speak<WH1696> to them in his wrath,<WH639> and vex<WH926> them in his sore displeasure.<WH2740>
Yet have I set<WH5258> my king<WH4428> on my holy<WH6944> hill<WH2022> of Zion.<WH6726>
I will declare<WH5608> the decree:<WH2706> the LORD<WH3068> has said<WH559> to me, You are my Son;<WH1121> this day<WH3117> have I begotten<WH3205> you.
Ask<WH7592> of me, and I shall give<WH5415> you the heathen<WH1471> for your inheritance,<WH5159> and the uttermost<WH657> parts of the earth<WH776> for your possession.<WH272>
You shall break<WH7489> them with a rod<WH7626> of iron;<WH1270> you shall dash<WH5310> them in pieces like a potter's<WH3335> vessel.<WH3627>
Be wise<WH7919> now<WH6258> therefore, O you kings:<WH4428> be instructed,<WH3256> you judges<WH8199> of the earth.<WH776>
Serve<WH5647> the LORD<WH3068> with fear,<WH3374> and rejoice<WH1523> with trembling.<WH7460>

Kiss<WH5401> the Son,<WH1248> lest<WH6435> he be angry,<WH599> and you perish<WH6> from the way,<WH1870> when<WH3588> his wrath<WH639> is kindled<WH1197> but a little.<WH4592> Blessed<WH835> are all<WH3605> they that put their trust<WH2620> in him.
